Practical Guide to Logistic Regression

This document excerpt details "Practical Guide to Logistic Regression", a resource focused on providing a foundational understanding and practical application of the logistic regression model. The guide aims to equip readers with the knowledge to effectively model binary response variables across a diverse range of fields. It emphasizes the model's utility in analyzing data from sectors like medical and health outcomes research, business analytics and data science, ecology, fisheries, astronomy, transportation, insurance, economics, recreation, and sports. The book’s core content centers around constructing, interpreting, and evaluating logistic models, including a detailed explanation of coefficients, odds ratios, and probability predictions with their standard errors. It provides a step-by-step approach to developing and interpreting both observation and grouped logistic models, alongside explorations of penalized and exact logistic regression techniques. A significant component involves modeling Bayesian logistic regression, offering a comprehensive approach to this statistical method. The guide utilizes R statistical software to demonstrate the models, and includes supplementary SAS and Stata code examples for all presented analyses. The author’s extensive experience in teaching and applying logistic regression is evident throughout, ensuring a practical and accessible learning experience. Ultimately, the document highlights the model's power in making predictions, classifications, and assessing the relative likelihood of different outcomes based on predictor variables. The book’s focus on real-world data examples, particularly those from health outcomes research, further enhances its practical value and applicability.

logistic regression binary response variable R statistical software SAS Stata odds ratios probabilities model fit Bayesian logistic regression coefficients
